html:
Nov 4 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.



THE GLOBE AND MAIL

Shaw Communications Inc. SJRb.TO says requests by Bell and Telus to delay a hearing into Shaw's proposed $26-billion merger with Rogers Communications Inc RCIb.TO are disingenuous and driven by the rival telecoms' own competitive interests. https://tgam.ca/3bDOAgL


Amazon.com Inc. AMZN.O has reinstated Canadian retailers that were abruptly suspended from its platform over a contentious new shipping policy, a situation that highlights growing tensions between the e-commerce giant and the small-business community. https://tgam.ca/3wh2wGX

Coveo Solutions Inc has filed to go public on the Toronto Stock Exchange, making it the second software enterprise company led by serial entrepreneur Louis Têtu to head to public markets – and the latest in a slew of Canadian technology companies to do so. https://tgam.ca/2ZWn3Vi

NATIONAL POST

Cenovus Energy Inc CVE.TO CEO Alex Pourbaix says his company will hit its debt target "imminently" thanks to either higher revenues from elevated oil and gas prices or expected proceeds from asset divestitures. https://bit.ly/2YdqCFQ


Canada's big banks have become more vulnerable to losses from economic shocks after increasing exposure to red-hot real estates markets in Vancouver and Toronto according to a new report from Moody's Investors Service. https://bit.ly/3wdkUAB

The government will raise the Maple Leaf on federal buildings in time for them to be lowered to half-mast to honour Canada’s war dead on Remembrance Day, according to a senior Liberal source. https://bit.ly/3EGAFCY


(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))
